item.description:
Join us for a WILD day on Plum Island, hiking, eating & drinking!

We'll begin with a hike through beach, dunes, and salt marsh with waves crashing and shore birds flying.

Parker River Wildlife Refuge contains almost 5,000 acres of diverse habitats including sandy beach and dune, cranberry bog, maritime forest and shrubland, and freshwater marsh. The most abundant habitat on the refuge is its 3,000+ acres of salt marsh, one of the most productive ecosystems on the planet. The refuge marsh is part of the "Great Marsh," the largest continuous salt marsh north of Long Island sound. The salt marsh includes not only the vast grasslands you see, but also the mud flats and open water salt pannes*.


But the refuge is best known for its abundant bird life. Over 350 species of birds have been recorded here, and the refuge is known as one of the top birding sights in the country. It is positioned at a key location along the Atlantic coast and at the mouth of Merrimac River, and attracts hundreds of shorebirds, waterfowl and songbirds as they seek to refuel during their migration.

Afterward, we'll join a

 Pig Roast Luau!

with LIVE MUSIC, drinks, dancing, and mountains of roast pork and other delicacies! 

And the party will last on into the night at the Plum Island BeachComa Restaurant & Bar! (It'll be a popular event so I'm trying to arrange a special table for us.)

This will be another fun day, ya think!?

Carpool: 11:45 am. Portsmouth Park & Ride 185 Grafton Ave. There are two parking lots. Meet in the overflow lot - the lot farthest from the main bus terminal building, farther up Grafton Ave. Meet at the very back of the lot.

We're meeting at a private home and walking about  1/4 mile down the beach and into the refuge. Many thanks to James S. for the generous use of his driveway!

No Pets or Pigs. Rain or Shine.

Liability Release - AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

*What are "salt pannes," you ask? They're those places in a salt marsh that retain water after the tide recedes, and then dry up later. They'll leave a mat of organic material (pond scum) but no marsh grass growing there. Now you know!
item.name: Beach Hike & Beach-Bar Luau Beach Bash!
